FuncDef:
The nqa server udpecho command configures a UDP server for an NQA test instance.
The undo nqa server udpecho command deletes a UDP server for an NQA test instance. The nqa server udpecho command configures a UDP server for an NQA test instance. The undo nqa server udpecho command deletes a UDP server for an NQA test instance. By default, no UDP server is configured for an NQA test.
CLIs: undo nqa server udpecho vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> { <ip-address> | ipv6 <ipv6-address> } <port-number>

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IPv4 address of the NQA server for monitoring UDP services.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the IPv6 address of the NQA server for monitoring UDP services.
The address is a 32-bit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Specifies the port number of the NQA server for monitoring UDP services.
The value is integer ranging from 1 to 65535. The well-known port number is not recommended.

Specifies the name of a VPN instance to which the UDP server belongs.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters.

ExtraInfo: To specify an NQA server for a UDP jitter test instance or a UDP test instance, run the nqa-server udpecho command. The UDP server responds to probe packets initiated by an NQA client.
